title: Winter/Spring Youth Cycling Training
course: Indoor training uses bike trainers and a mix of dry-land training stations
registration: No fee but a USAC waiver required to participate
directions: 5-6:30 at chalet building next to Northbrook Velodrome

title: MTB Early Season Camp
description: Early Season MTB Camp $450 for entire week
course: DuPont State Forest has over 80 miles of MTB Trails.
notes: This is a non-competitive early season MTB camp.
directions: Contact Randy Warren, randy@warrencycling.com for more information.

title: Alderman Cappleman's Lincoln Park Criterium
description: ALDERMAN CAPPLEMAN'S 46TH WARD LINCOLN PARK CRITERIUM
course: 0.8-mile (1.3km) course along Chicago lakefront near Montrose Beach on the northern end of Lincoln Park. Course features two 90-degree turns, one 180-degree turn on a 60-foot wide road, and two easy bends that riders can pedal all the way through.
registration:
Race-day registration opens at 7:00 AM and closes 20 minutes prior to each event.  Pre-register online at usacycling.org, registration fee included in the prices stated above.  Day of registration includes $5 surcharge.

Register for a 2nd or 3rd race online at usacycling.org for $10 per additional race.  Multi-race discount does not apply to day-of registration, even if pre-registered for another event.  Pre-registration will close Wednesday April 1st at 11:59pm.
notes:
Racing rain, snow or shine.  All USA Cycling rules apply.  All riders must wear a helmet whenever on a bicycle at this event.  For more information, please visit www.xxxracing.org or contact Kevin O’Neill at lpc@xxxracing.org.

A minimum of five racers must be present for each category race to be held.  Races may be shortened or combined at the discretion of the Chief Official.
directions:
Directions: Use Lake Shore Drive and northern exits near Montrose Harbor. Parking can be accessed via Montrose Ave, Wilson Ave., and Lawrence Ave.  Start/Finish and registration are on the east side of the course near the Montrose Dog Beach.  Parking is available along Simonds Drive north of Lawrence Ave. and south of Wilson Ave., and in the Wilson Parking Lot (pay lot operated by Chicago Park District) adjacent to the Wilson Skate Park.

Start/Finish and registration are on the east side of the course closest to the lake.

Great Egyptian Omnium
description: The Great Egyptian Omnium is a two day, three stage event featuring a road race, a time trial and a criterium
course:
The Don Luna Road Race is a 20 mile loop around the town of Creal Springs, IL.
The Bike Surgeon Time Trial is a 7.5 mile course also in Creal Springs.
The Continent Tire Criterium is held on the campus of John A Logan College in Carterville, IL
registration: Registrations can be completed at www.greategyptianomnium.org or contact Brian Simpson at 812-354-4509 or cbsimpson5@yahoo.com
notes: Riders must compete in all three stages to be eligible for Omnium prizes and awards.
directions:
From the North take I-57 to exit 54A in Marion; merge onto Hwy 13 East for 6.1 miles; at stop light head south on Hwy 166 toward Creal Springs for 8.5 miles.  Registration will be located at the Creal Springs City Park (295 E. Blue Ave).
Sundays events will be held at John A Logan College located in Carterville, IL

title: Gran Fondo Hundo presented by Higher Gear
Half Acre Cycling's CX Eliminator
description: Half Acre Cycling's CX Eliminator will be a cyclo-cross race similar to XC Eliminator racing.  Each racer will be guaranteed at least two races: one in the Seed Round and one or more in the Elimination Round(s).  Races may be split or joined, depending on registrations.
course: The course will conform to USACycling guidelines for cyclocross racing, with accommodations made for and eliminator event, namely separate start and finish areas.  The race will be held at Westchester Woods in Westchester, IL.  The course will feature a little bit of everything.
registration:
BikeReg https://www.bikereg.com/cx-eliminator

Early Registration:  $20 < 8/3
8/3 - 8/8: $25

Day-of Regsitration closes 40 minutes before race start time.
notes: The published start times are the start of the Seed Rounds.  After all the Seed Rounds, Elimination Rounds will be held until there is a winner in each class.  Please make sure you check-in and get your numbers on at least 30 minutes before your start time.

title: Rhythm & Blues Revue Fat Tire Fun Ride
Melas CX- Basin Racin’ p/b Garner Cyclery
Afterglow - A Cyclocross Race
description:
Chicago Cuttin' Crew comes together to give you a few cooldown laps after all the Chicago Cyclocross Cup races are over and the State Championship jerseys have been given out. Now we race because we love cyclocross. When the snow starts to fall and the morning greets us with darkness, we will venture out and endure because it's the competition that keeps us going.

We've again partnered with Chicago Parks District to bring the ‘Glow to the Douglas Park Golf Course! The course is a fenced-in 3-hole course ripe with opportunities to grow our sport in the City of Chicago, and we would be honored for you to participate.

We'll continue our history of offering only glory to the winners to keep registration fees low. We're not in it for the money, we're in it because we love doing this and we love doing it with you.

Blackstone Bicycle Works and West Town Bikes continue to be our beneficiaries because no one does local youth cycling programs better. Consider donating a couple more bucks to go directly toward their cyclocross teams!
course: 1.5-mile Spectator-friendly course through a park with wooded section, some elevation and a beach that you probably shouldn't enter. Typical cyclocross course shenanigans.
registration:
Race day registration opens at 9:00AM and closes 30 minutes before each race. Online registration closes the Thursday evening prior to the race.

•           Register online at http://www.BikeReg.com/Afterglow. Day-Of Entry fees are cash (preferred) or check (bring cash). We might be able to take PayPal if you're nice about it. Preregistration will close when the combined registration reaches the 100-rider field limit.

•           Day of registration incurs a $5 late fee. All riders must sign a USAC rider release form which includes a City of Chicago waiver.

•          2nd or 3rd or 4th or 5th race of the day is $10, pre-reg or day-of. Pre-reg multi-race discount ONLY applies when you register in one session.

•          M123 and M3 choice should be however you want to match up for USAC rankings or Crossresults points.
notes:
•          * Single Speed Open Requirements: One usable gear. Zip ties on SRAM shifters only.

•          ** Fatbike Etc Open Requirements: 3.5” minimum tire size (as printed on tire) OR Tandems. Tandems will be scored separately. Only one member of Tandem teams need to register. Price is per bicycle. Both riders must sign USAC waiver.

•          *** WHO WILL DEFEND SWEET JUSTICE???

•          **** INSANEDEMONIUM Rules: sign up for as many races as you can. Women can add 10 years to the age to race masters, and both tandem riders' laps will count toward their overall laps. Rider with the most laps throughout the day wins! ALL riders are welcome to participate. If you have already registered and want the multiple discount reg or have questions about categories, shoot us an email at chicagocuttincrew at gmail dot com, and we'll get you a coupon code.
